Amazing Idea!
This is a cool idea but shouldnâ€™t you make your own ore and say copper can be found in the over world. Also Minecraft likes to be semi realistic so copper wouldnâ€™t be that strong.

I just thinking about moving copper from my dimension idea to the nether, because we donâ€™t an iron equivalent in the nether. Heck, my dimension idea could also probably be turned into a biome in the nether, maybe.

I love the idea but how can a weak metal like Copper be stronger than a strong rare gemstone like diamond. Maybe a different ore like Amethyst or something more of value like Rose gold. Rose gold can be a useful stronger form of gold. Maybe Copper can be crafted into Copper wire that is used as Underwater Redstone or something instead of being stronger than Diamond.

I decided that instead having copper in this idea, I replaced it with celestine. Itâ€™s name sounds like it could be found in the sky, and so I think the ore could only be found on sky islands. And thanks to WaxierBuzzard54 for pointing my mistake, in the fact that copper isnâ€™t supposed to be stronger than diamonds. Furthermore, in another idea I posted, I suggested that copper can be the nether alternative to iron, and thus, me leaving copper in this idea would make no sense.

Exactly what I was looking for when I found this site now, for the first time. Height limit is currently 256 blocks?

I cannot even imagine what 4096 blocks would do, but a whole new dimension to travel in?

I want that. As aeroplanes became for humans, altitude with that magnitude and the tools to use that plane in a decent way, maybe with a spider addon. It would take some time to get used to it, if our brains even allow it. I guess they do.
With a slightly higher height limit, I think we would be able to build even greater creations and it gives a whole lot of room to work with!
If we donâ€™t need mobs,it would be too easy and illogical
Maybe something like Terraria where you need a certain amount of those blocks, mobs might be hard to implement.

I've been thinking of this forever, i fully agree that it absolutely needs to be in the game at this point. However having to gather the respective biome blocks makes sense but entirely defeats the purpose of adding artificial biomes in my opinion. its very frustrating not being able to find bamboo or the right tree when i need them most its almost as if they expect you to find the right biomes or treasure chests. I figured you could have traded with villagers to get things that might not be aquirable in your world for a long while however ive recently learned for whatever reason be it Balancing reasons or whatever its simply not possible like wtf? isnt that the entire point of villagers? i mean i could be wrong but i cant find any reason this would affect balancing or gameplay. there NEEDS to be an easier way to aquire all the biome resources in the game without needing to actually find a non existent biome. I'm very frustrated no one else seems to be talking about this, is there something i am unaware of? being incredibly likely i still cant find any reason it shouldnt be in the game like seriously wth?? it still feels like minecraft is unfinished which many people would argue is a good thing me being one of those people, however it just seems like theres always been missing features that affect the way we would like to play the game. i cant help but feel underwhelmed saying this out loud this should be a feature!!

I respect the mojang team and I entirely trust their love and care when it comes to their game i think we all have enough evidence of this. i cant help my feeling of uncertainty when it comes to what people think Minecraft should be. I cant help but feel like the mojang team doesnt seem to be like any traditional corporation its very apparent that they love their own game not because it brings in revenue but because of their love for playing the game just as we would. i admit that when the game started changing i was one of the people hating a bit due to the nostalgia of waiting however many years for mcpe 1.8 thinking of all the cool aesthetic things id finally be able to accomplish using minecarts. Recently however ive drastically changed my opinion on what minecraft should be i feel like we should trust what minecraft should be change can be good many people hate on the new ore textures , what people dont think about is the amount of hours that went into feeling like changing the ores everyone grew up with would be in vain, someone spent their own time and resources trying to make the game better for us. I think we can all agree on the improvements as well as setbacks throughout the years. I think we should sit back and let nature take its course a game like minecraft being ruined would ultimately bring about the apocalypse. i know this has nothing to do with the submission but its got me thinking about what people expect from an old game.
any similarities to terraria would be desirable.

Iâ€™m was initially a bit upset with the ore changes myself having played Minecraft since 2013. However one of the reasons the texture was changed was so that color blind people could play more easily and tell the difference between ore. I think the change was necessary and also it does look better in my opinion. Although I have to wonder, why is there 2 different diamond ore textures now?

The reason I want this is because I need too gather coco beans unfortunately my world is covered with plains, its the first realm we have ever had and we have done some amazing work and we thought we would be fine with the lack of other bioms until I realised the only way you can grow coxobeans is on a jungle tree in the jungle bioms.

If you could have a mini artificial jungle biom just too grow the beans this would be helpful even if you had too use a type of light block too act as a heat source or somthing.

I think itâ€™s a great idea, although instead of just having jungle trees perhaps there should be Monkey Puzzle trees as well or as a replacement to jungle trees. I suggest this because monkey puzzle trees grow in dry deserts and it would make sense to have a tree type that is natural in the biome.

Maybe a variant of lemurs (if they are added with this) can live here to attack those who use the biome for mass deforestation. It would be as large as the players and do a decent amount of damage. They also live in packs in the trees. Holding an axe would make them attack you as well. Smaller lemurs would be passive and defenseless, so these larger lemurs can protect them.

witches, witches and even more witches

The introduction to a haunted forest could include:

  • Abandoned villages
  • Woodland mansions could be moved here with an updated spooky look
  • New temple/shrine/ritual alters
  • Updated witches - Witches haven't seen love in a very long time. Why not include warlocks as well. They should also spawn much more frequently.
  • New mobs (possibly werewolf, ghoul, or undead...not to be confused with zombies) - These shouldn't spawn very frequently, but should be difficult to defeat. Reward drops could be used at an alter to spawn in a mini boss.
  • Mini boss - Necromancer. The necromancer could have the ability to spawn in skeletons and zombies, as well as other abilities as well. The totem of undying seems more fitting for a necromancer to drop.

Good idea, should include Ghosts and other spooky beings, a unique tree type for biome and couples of unique mobs, fauna, plants and so forth, some of them including the plants could kill you, so yeah
